Thambhāropaka’s Birth Story
“When the Lord of the World had passed away,
the supreme one who saw the Dhamma,
I erected a flagpole
at the shrine of the best of Buddhas.
Having had a ladder made,
I climbed up to the best of shrines;
Having taken a jasmine flower,
I placed it on the shrine.
Oh the Buddhas! Oh the Dhamma!
Oh the perfection of our Teacher!
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping a shrine.
For ninety-four aeons,
there were kings named Thūpasīha,
sixteen of them, kings who were universal monarchs,
of great strength.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the elder Thambhāropaka recited these verses.
